accepted_missions.description: A series of temporal anomalies have altered the universe, merging past, present, future, and mirror timelines into one. Work with Q to investigate these anomalies, and learn how you can bring order to this chaos.
Pirates, rogue holograms, and formerly eradicated diseases are only a few of the problems plaguing this area. Handle each in turn to bring order to the region.

From renegade androids to ancient civilizations born anew, the temporal crisis has brought chaos to every corner of the galaxy. Set the standard for all Starfleet captains by dealing with each threat in turn.
Q hasn't taken an active role in resolving the temporal anomaly crisis, and Starfleet is ready for answers. Get Q's attention, and then begin an epic journey into the Continuum itself.
Could the Federation be responsible for the temporal crisis? Captain Janeway can't confirm or deny she knows the answer, but she has sent Voyager's EMH to help investigate.
Q has volunteered to assist the Federation during this temporal crisis, but can he be trusted? Join legendary Starfleet captains of the past to seek help from other powerful beings.

The temporal crisis has brought new conflict to the already fractious Klingon Empire, where vengeance, deceit, and rebellion are the least of a captain's worries. Respond to these distress calls before the Empire falls further into disorder.
Aid the crew of the Discovery in matters both personal and professional, close to home and light years away.

reward.name: Chronitons
reward.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

missions.title: Ex Astris, Scientia
missions.speaker: Admiral William T. Riker
missions.description: "The Federation wouldn't exist without Starfleet. We might be stretched thin, but I'm going to personally ensure that every officer still here is held to the same high standards I hold myself."
missions.requirement: You may only use <#808080>Common and <#50AA3C>Uncommon crew with the Starfleet trait on this Cadet Challenge.

missions.title: The United Federation
missions.speaker: Admiral William T. Riker
missions.description: "I had the honor of serving with Worf, Starfleet's first Klingon recruit, and the Enterprise was all the better for it. A diverse crew is a stronger crew, as I intend to prove."
missions.requirement: You may only use <#808080>Common</color> and <#50AA3C>Uncommon</color> crew who are <#CC0000>alien</color> or <#CC0000>part alien</color> on this Cadet Challenge.

missions.title: A Certain Formality
missions.speaker: Admiral William T. Riker
missions.description: "Standards aren't just slipping in Starfleet. They're slipping all over the Federation, particularly when it comes to equality. Your crew's going to put a stop to it."
missions.requirement: You may only use <#808080>Common</color> and <#50AA3C>Uncommon</color> crew who are <#CC0000>Female</color> on this Cadet Challenge.

missions.title: Adv: A Certain Formality
missions.speaker: Admiral William T. Riker

missions.requirement: You may only use <#5AAAFF>Rare</color> crew who are <#CC0000>Female</color> on this Cadet Challenge.

missions.requirement: You may only use <#5AAAFF>Rare</color> crew who are <#CC0000>alien</color> or <#CC0000>part alien</color> on this Advanced Challenge.

crew.name: Admiral Riker
crew.flavor: Originally from Q's final test of Picard, Admiral Riker used the Enterprise-D to seal an anti-time rift.

crew.name: Shinzon
crew.flavor: A clone of Jean-Luc Picard, Shinzon captained the mighty Scimitar warship against the U.S.S. Enterprise-E.

crew.name: General Chang
crew.flavor: Chief of Staff to Chancellor Gorkon, Chang conspired to bring about a Klingon-Federation war.

crew.name: Commander Troi
crew.flavor: Stranded on Earth in the 21st century, Troi helped convince Cochrane to take his historic flight.

crew.name: Mirror Phlox
crew.flavor: A sadistic doctor serving on board the I.S.S Enterprise, a starship from the mirror universe.

crew.name: Admiral Janeway
crew.flavor: Within two years of successfully returning home from the Delta Quadrant, Janeway was promoted to the rank of Vice Admiral.

crew.name: T'Kuvma
crew.flavor: T'Kuvma sought to unify the fractious Klingon Empire against the Federation.

crew.name: One
crew.flavor: A fusion of Seven's nanoprobes with the Doctor's mobile emitter, was in effect a 29th century Borg.

crew.name: Mintakan Riker
crew.flavor: On a mission to gauge cultural contamination on Mintaka, Riker presented himself as a Mintakan trader.

crew.name: The One, Lore
crew.flavor: After stealing an emotion chip intended for Data, Lore became the leader of a breakaway Borg ship.

action.name: We're In A Lot Of Trouble

crew.name: Mirror T'Pol
crew.flavor: A Vulcan slave of the Terran Empire, T'Pol joins with other nonhumans in a revolt.

crew.name: Garak, Elim Garak
crew.flavor: Curious as to Bashir's activities, Garak breaks into Bashir's secret agent holoprogram and joins him.

crew.name: "Dark Ages" McCoy
crew.flavor: McCoy infiltrated a 1980s San Francisco hospital to rescue a gravely-wounded Chekov.

action.name: You Don't Trust Me, Do You?
Why Talk, When We Can Dance?

crew.name: Durango Troi
crew.flavor: A fan of the 'Ancient West' since childhood, Deanna played the role of Durango in the Deadwood holoprogram.

crew.name: Phoenix Cochrane
crew.flavor: Developer of the first human warp drive, Zefram Cochrane was the target of a Borg attack in 2063.

crew.name: Armed Philippa Georgiou
crew.flavor: Captain Georgiou to excavate a Crepusculan well that had gone dry and save the species from drought.

action.name: You Know How Much I Hate To Lose
Logic Is The Beginning Of Wisdom
Let Us See What The Future Holds
This Is Where Heroes Are Made
I Don't Respond Well To Threats
I Die Not For Myself But For You

crew.name: Indulgent Seven
crew.flavor: In an effort to conceal the Doctor from the Lokirrim, Seven downloads his program into her cybernetic matrix.

action.name: You Can't Climb A Mountain On Crumbs!
I Can Take Care Of Myself

crew.name: First Officer Burnham
crew.flavor: A Starfleet commander, Michael Burnham was the first officer of the U.S.S. Shenzhou.

action.name: Everything I Said Was The Truth!
How Are The Stone Knives And Bearskins?

crew.name: Mirror Spock
crew.flavor: First Officer of the I.S.S Enterprise, Spock was a ruthless officer in the mirror universe's Terran Empire.

crew.name: Yarnek
crew.flavor: Yarnek forced Enterprise crew into a battle of 'good' vs. 'evil' for the edification of the Excalbian people.

crew.name: Borg Queen
crew.flavor: Originally a member of Borg-designated Species 125, the Borg Queen brought order to the chaos of the hive mind.

crew.name: Torchbearer Rejac
crew.flavor: Guardian of the Beacon of Kahless.

crew.name: Klingon Bride Jadzia
crew.flavor: Jadzia chose traditional Klingon wedding attire for her marriage to Lieutenant Commander Worf.

crew.name: Lt. Commander La Forge
crew.flavor: After tangling with the Borg, Geordi found himself and the Enterprise-E back in 2063.

crew.name: Edith Keeler
crew.flavor: Edith administered a New York mission, near where Kirk was forced to allow her to die in traffic to preserve his timeline.

crew.name: The Professor
crew.flavor: Built by the Enterprise's computer, The Professor was built to be Detective Data's ultimate challenge.

crew.name: T'Mir
crew.flavor: Part of a Vulcan science vessel that crashed on Earth, T'Mir assumed command of the survivors.

action.name: The Old Michael Burnham is Dead

crew.name: Rura Penthe Kirk
crew.flavor: Convicted of the murder of Chancellor Gorkon, Kirk was sent to Rura Penthe, the 'Alien's Graveyard'.

crew.name: Captain John Harriman
crew.flavor: Captain of the Enterpise-B, Harriman's first mission was to rescue El-Aurian refugee ships from the Nexus.

action.name: I'm A Physician, Not An Engineer!
I Didn't Want to Disillusion Him

crew.name: Ardra
crew.flavor: A legendary devil-figure on Ventax II, a con artist impersonated her in order to take control of the planet.

action.name: The Light, It Is Almost Like Music

crew.name: Commander Kang
crew.flavor: Tricked into a confrontation with Kirk, Kang and his counterpart were forced to work together to defeat their incorporeal manipulator.

crew.name: Executive Director Hugh
crew.flavor: A former Borg drone, Hugh became Executive Director of the Borg Reclamation Project.

crew.name: Bashir, Julian Bashir
crew.flavor: Bashir played the role of a secret agent in a recreational holosuite program.

action.name: I'm Not Staying To Make Friends
My Paws And Whiskers, I'll Be Late!

crew.name: Commander Barak
crew.flavor: Captain of the K'tinga-class I.K.S Amar, Barak and his ship were destroyed by V'ger.

crew.name: Mobile Doctor
crew.flavor: Equipped with a 29th Century mobile holoemitter, this EMH was no longer restricted in movement.

crew.name: RAF Miles O'Brien
crew.flavor: O'Brien and Bashir often enjoyed a holorecreation of the Battle of Britain campaign.

action.name: It Was Better When We Were Separate
What Small, Frail Creatures You Are

crew.name: Mirror Regent Worf
crew.flavor: The brutal Regent of the Klingon-Cardassian Alliance in a mirror universe.

action.name: I Have A Lot To Learn
Do You Remember Anything At All?

crew.name: Disguised Kira
crew.flavor: Disguised as a Bajoran prisoner, Kira snuck into a Cardassian camp to rescue Resistance leader Li Nalas.

crew.name: Mirror 'Smiley' O'Brien
crew.flavor: Leader of the Terran Rebellion, 'Smiley' O'Brien commanded the I.S.S. Defiant against the KCA.

action.name: The Time For Diplomacy Is Past

crew.name: Doctor Chaotica
crew.flavor: Villain of the Captain Proton holonovel, Doctor Chaotica once waged war against photonic lifeforms from subspace.

action.name: You May Have Just Saved The Entire Alpha Quadrant

crew.name: Goddess of Empathy Troi
crew.flavor: Ship's counselor Deanna Troi was envisioned as the Goddess of Empathy in a holodeck program of Reginald Barclay's.

crew.name: Aviator Yar
crew.flavor: Inspired by the holodeck adventures of O'Brien and Bashir, Aviator Yar was released in the Second Battle of New York event.

crew.name: Humanoid Figure
crew.flavor: Unable to appear physically, the elusive humanoid figure attempts to manipulate affairs from the distant 28th century.

crew.name: Alicia Travers
crew.flavor: A member of the resistance in New York. Alicia helps Archer liberate her city and restore the 20th century timeline.

crew.name: Maquis Tuvok
crew.flavor: On a mission from Starfleet to infiltrate the Maquis, Tuvok joined Chakotay's ship and cell.

crew.name: Jhamel
crew.flavor: A member of the Aenar subspecies, Jhamel used her telepathy to find and contact her brother through the use of a telepresence unit.

action.name: Able To Hang In A Firefight A Little Longer

crew.name: EV Suit T'Pol
crew.flavor: Sub-commander T'Pol boards a dangerous Klingon ship as it descends into the depths of a gas giant.

crew.name: Kivas Fajo
crew.flavor: A collector of rare, strange, and sometimes illegal items, Kivas Fajo faked Data's death in order to add the android into his collection.

crew.name: Emory Erickson
crew.flavor: Under false pretenses, Erickson sought to use his invention of the molecular transporter to save his son trapped in sub-space.

action.name: You'll Be Able To Leave The Lights On

crew.name: Altan Inigo Soong
crew.flavor: Working with Sutra, Soong built a beacon to contact the protectors of synthetic life for the creations he considered his children.

action.name: I Suppose That's What Mothers Do

crew.name: Awaiting Amanda Grayson
crew.flavor: After pleading with Spock to help his father, Sarek, Amanda anxiously waits for the procedure to be complete.

action.name: Your Duty Is To Your Father

crew.name: Dignitary Sarek
crew.flavor: Hiding his heart affliction, Sarek stands tall against a particularly tenacious Tellarite.

crew.name: EV Suit Spock
crew.flavor: Feeling a connection to the consciousness of V-ger, Spock stole equipment to seek his answers.

crew.name: Captain Solok
crew.flavor: When reuniting with an old colleague, Captain Solok seeks to repair his ship and provoke an emotional response through competition.

crew.name: T'Pring
crew.flavor: Not quite Spock's wife and not quite his betrothed, T'Pring claimed kal-if-fee in order to be with Stonn instead.

action.name: I Am Well Able To Defeat You
Let Us See What The Future Holds
Let Me Show You What Will Happen
Do You Know Who I Am?

crew.name: Maquis Takeover Seska
crew.flavor: A year after her death, Seska leaves one last surprise for the Voyager crew in an abandoned holoprogram.

crew.name: Maquis Takeover Paris
crew.flavor: Paris steps back into his Maquis identity to save Voyager from a holoprogram sabotaged by Seska.

action.name: We Have to Find My Friends

crew.name: Carlos Data
crew.flavor: Lieutenant Data takes on the role of Carlos in one of Picard's Dixon Hill holonovels.

action.name: I'll See You In Hell First!

crew.name: Booker and Grudge
crew.flavor: Booker is a courier who makes deliveries and smuggling goods in order to get enough dilithium to keep going with his queen, Grudge.

crew.name: Sahil
crew.flavor: After forty years of dutiful isolation, Sahil is commissioned as a Federation communications officer.

action.name: It Would Be My Honor to Assist You

crew.name: Courier Burnham
crew.flavor: Joining up with Booker, Burnham helps as a courier while she awaits the return of Discovery.

action.name: I Thought We Had An Agreement
It's about time you came back

crew.name: Mirror Saru
crew.flavor: As a slave, the previously unnamed Kelpien attends to Captain Burnham.

crew.name: C.O.P. Founder Picard
crew.flavor: Stepping in for the missing Jonathan Archer, Picard helped form the Coalition of Planets. (Second Battle of New York player vote winner!)

action.name: Halt In The Name of Chaotica!

crew.name: Klingon K'Ehleyr
crew.flavor: About to embark on a mission to re-integrate Klingons from a time of war, K'Ehleyr professes her feelings for Worf.

crew.name: Judge Q
crew.flavor: All-powerful judge and jury, Q placed the Enterprise-D's crew on trial at Farpoint.

crew.name: Gray
crew.flavor: Now a part of Adira, Gray supports them unseen.

crew.name: Luau Paris
crew.flavor: Paris slips into his classic Big Daddy-O Surf Special shirt before attending a luau with his crewmates.

action.name: It's Not The Weapon, It's The Soldier

crew.name: Enterprise-E Picard
crew.flavor: Crashed on 21st century Earth, Captain Picard found himself up against the implacable Borg Queen.

action.name: For A Moment I Was Everywhere

crew.name: Lt. Commander Dexter Remmick
crew.flavor: Inhabited by a parasite, Remmick infiltrated Starfleet Command to compromise their command structure for nefarious purposes.

action.name: This Is An Act Of Mercy

crew.name: Caldos IV Crusher
crew.flavor: Beverly Crusher encounters an anaphasic lifeform tied to a family heirloom.

crew.name: Adira Tal
crew.flavor: Adira, now properly joined with the Trill Symbiont Tal, re-acquires their memories from their previous lives.

crew.name: Bridal Deanna Troi
crew.flavor: Celebrating their marriage, Deanna enjoys the festivities of her human heritage with a traditional reception.

action.name: I'd Hate to Make Your Life Difficult

crew.name: Wyatt Miller
crew.flavor: Cancelling his wedding with Deanna, Wyatt joins the Tarellians in the hopes of helping them find a cure to the virus that has nearly wiped out their civilization.

action.name: What I Want Is To Cure People

crew.name: Lothario Q
crew.flavor: Of all the females, of all the species, in all the galaxy--Q drops in to inform Janeway of his plans of becoming a parent.

crew.name: Wyatt Earp
crew.flavor: Created by the Melkot to punish a trespassing party of the Enterprise, this replica of a wild west icon believes Kirk, Spock, Bones, Scotty, and Chekov to be members of the Clanton gang.

crew.name: Forra Gegen
crew.flavor: A Voth molecular paleontologist, Gegen learned that the saurian species had originally developed on Earth.

crew.name: Cyrus Redblock
crew.flavor: A holographic gangster, this Dixon Hill villain held Starfleet participants hostage during a Holodeck malfunction.

crew.name: Miral Torres
crew.flavor: Miral appeared on the Barge of the Dead to her daughter, B'Elanna, during a near-death vision.

crew.name: Fal-tor-pan Spock
crew.flavor: After undergoing the Fal-tor-pan ceremony, a revived Spock begins to put his fragmented memory back together.

crew.name: Reunion Spock and Kirk
crew.flavor: As Spock's memories return to him, Kirk with the crew of the Enterprise gathers around him in solidarity.

action.name: I have been and ever shall be your friend.

crew.name: 23rd Century Martok
crew.flavor: A version of Martok from an alternate universe, born into the Klingon Empire during the twenty-third century.

crew.name: Formal Dress Wesley Crusher
crew.flavor: Wesley returned from his journey with the Traveller and attended the Troi-Riker wedding in 2379.

crew.name: Captain T'Pol
crew.flavor: When Archer was infected by temporal parasites, T'Pol took command of the Enterprise.

crew.name: Commander Kira Nerys
crew.flavor: To facilitate contact with the Cardassian rebels, Kira was given a Starfleet field commission.

crew.name: Princess Jadzia
crew.flavor: In an attempt to entertain Major Kira, Jadzia arranged a visit to a Camelot holoprogram.

crew.name: George and Gracie
crew.flavor: After being rescued from whalers by Kirk and crew in 1986, these heroes saved the world in the 23rd century by singing at a deep space probe

crew.name: Amal Chakotay
crew.flavor: Chakotay disguised himself as Amal to infiltrate a Quarren workcamp and rescue the brainwashed crew of Voyager.

action.name: Let Me Prove Who I Am

crew.name: Barry Waddle
crew.flavor: A Klingon Intelligence Operative disguised as a Human merchant, Barry was trapped on Cardassia Prime during the Klingon-Cardassian War.

crew.name: Human Saru
crew.flavor: A malfunctioning holoprogram aboard the wreckage of the KSF Khi'eth made Saru appear human.

crew.name: Bajoran Culber
crew.flavor: A malfunctioning holoprogram aboard the wreckage of the KSF Khi'eth made Culber appear Bajoran.

crew.name: KDF Alexander
crew.flavor: Joined the Rotarran as a member of the Klingon Defense Force, against his father's wishes.

action.name: Society Could Use A Little Chaos

crew.name: Lt. Tasha Yar
crew.flavor: Security Chief of the U.S.S. Enterprise-D. Later killed in action by an alien lifeform.

ships.name: U.S.S. Enterprise NCC-1701-D
ships.flavor: A Galaxy-class vessel famously commanded by Captain Picard. Allows for saucer separation in emergency situations.

ships.name: Galaxy Class Ship
ships.flavor: One of the largest and most powerful classes of ship in Starfleet's history.

ships.name: Borg Cube
ships.flavor: A smaller version of the Collective's ubiquitous and fearsome cubical spacecraft. Features self-repairing systems.

ships.name: Klingon K'Vort Bird-of-Prey
ships.flavor: A versatile craft often used for scouting and patrolling. The K'Vort-class is the most stable iteration of this design.

ships.name: U.S.S. Enterprise NCC-1701
ships.flavor: A Constitution-class vessel made legend under the command of Captain Kirk. A hardy ship that survived many encounters.

ships.name: Constitution Class Ship
ships.flavor: The face of Starfleet in the 23rd century, these heavy cruisers were designed for long-term missions.

ships.name: Cardassian Galor Cruiser
ships.flavor: The "foot soldier" of the Cardassian Union, nimble and destructive. Features multiple phaser arrays.

ships.name: Ferengi D'Kora Marauder
ships.flavor: An enigmatic vessel used for battle and transport. Capable of disabling a deflector shield.

ships.name: Nova Class
ships.flavor: Designed for short-term missions of science and exploration. Features advanced sensor arrays.

ships.name: U.S.S. Defiant
ships.flavor: Initially created for use against the Borg. Equipped with ablative armor and Starfleet's first legal cloaking device.

ships.name: Defiant-Class Ship
ships.flavor: Named after the initial prototype, brought into production during the Dominion War to serve as warships.

ships.name: Jem'Hadar Fighter
ships.flavor: A warship used by the soldier species of the Dominion. Equipped with phased polaron beam weapons

ships.name: Intrepid-Class Ship
ships.flavor: Designed for long-term exploration. Able to land on the surface of a planet and powered by bio-neural gel packs.

ships.name: U.S.S. Voyager
ships.flavor: A Intrepid-class vessel notable for being the first to explore the Delta Quadrant--if not by choice.

ships.name: Romulan D'deridex Warbird
ships.flavor: One of the largest and most advanced vessels in the quadrant. Utilizes a forced quantum singularity as a power source.

ships.name: Constellation Class
ships.flavor: Uniquely designed with four warp nacelles. Most often deployed for exploration and defensive patrols.

ships.name: H.M.S. Bounty
ships.flavor: A Klingon bird-of-prey commandeered by Admiral James T. Kirk. Ironically named Bounty by CMO Leonard "Bones" McCoy.

ships.name: Maquis Raider
ships.flavor: A small and manueverable ship, favored by the Maquis for quick escapes and durability under hostile pursuit.

ships.name: Val Jean
ships.flavor: A Maquis raider commanded by Chakotay. This vessel was destroyed after colliding with the Caretaker's array.

ships.name: I.S.S. Enterprise NCC-1701
ships.flavor: A Constitution-class vessel made legend under the command of Captain Kirk. A hardy ship that survived many encounters.

ships.name: D'Kora Krayton
ships.flavor: An enigmatic vessel used for battle and transport. Capable of disabling a deflector shield.

ships.name: Prakesh
ships.flavor: Gul Dukat's Galor Class vessel, famed for its service in the Klingon-Cardassian War.

ships.name: NX-Class Ship
ships.flavor: The first Starfleet ships to be equipped with warp five engines, allowing exploration beyond neighboring star systems.

ships.name: NX-01 Enterprise
ships.flavor: The flagship of United Earth Starfleet, pivotal in founding the Coalition of Planets, a precursor to the UFP.

ships.name: Hirogen Hunter Ship
ships.flavor: Small but heavily-armed, these vessels are equipped to allow for efficient hunting and processing of game.

ships.name: Hirogen Warship
ships.flavor: Small but heavily-armed, these vessels are equipped to allow for efficient hunting and processing of game.

ships.name: Borg Sphere
ships.flavor: Borg spheres were primarily scout and long-range tactical vessels. Borg cubes sometimes housed Borg spheres as auxillary craft.

ships.name: Borg Sphere 878
ships.flavor: Commandeered by General Kotok and other rebel Borg members of Unimatrix Zero in 2377.

ships.name: Klingon K't'inga Battlecruiser
ships.flavor: A follow up to the powerful D7 Battlecruiser, the K't'inga Class was the primary warship of the Klingon Empire in the late 23rd century.

ships.name: IKS T'Ong
ships.flavor: A K't'inga Class Klingon Battlecruiser, the I.K.S T'Ong gained fame while on a crucial mission under the command of Captain K'Temoc.

ships.name: U.S.S. Shenzhou
ships.flavor: A Walker-class vessel involved in the Battle at the Binary Stars. Ship motto - 'All existing things are really one.'

ships.name: U.S.S. Discovery
ships.flavor: A pioneering science vessel, the crew of U.S.S. Discovery developed a method to safely traverse great distances in an instant with her spore drive.

ships.name: I.S.S. Defiant
ships.flavor: Based on plans taken from the Prime Universe, the I.S.S. Defiant was built and commanded by Mirror 'Smiley' O'Brien to lead the insurgency against Regent Worf.

ships.name: I.S.S. Avenger
ships.flavor: Registered NX-09, the I.S.S Avenger NX-Class Battleship served alongside the I.S.S. Enterprise in the 22nd Century. It met its demise at the hands of the U.S.S Defiant.

ships.name: Terran Empire Constellation Class
ships.flavor: The Constellation Class was a Terran Empire Battle Cruiser that entered service in the late 23rd century.

ships.name: Klingon Sarcophagus
ships.flavor: Flagship of the House of T'Kuvma, the Sarcophagus was armored by thousands of caskets containing remains of Klingon warriors known as the 'Black Fleet'.

ships.name: Andorian Battlecruiser Kumari
ships.flavor: A first of its kind Andorian Battlecruiser named after the first ice-cutter to circumnavigate Andoria.

ships.name: Orion Syndicate Interceptor
ships.flavor: A moderately armed ship used by the Orion Syndicate.

ships.name: Ni'Var
ships.flavor: The Ni'Var was sent by Vulcan High Command to transfer Subcommander T'Pol after her involvement in the destruction of the Vulcan Monastery on P'Jem.

ships.name: Suurok Class Combat Cruiser
ships.flavor: Used as both a Combat Cruiser or a Science Vessel, the Suurok Class was among the fastest and most powerful starships operating in the Vulcan fleet.

ships.name: Miranda Class Ship
ships.flavor: Miranda Class

ships.name: U.S.S Reliant
ships.flavor: U.S.S Reliant

ships.name: Romulan Valdore-type Warbird
ships.flavor: Valdore-type Warbird

ships.name: The Valdore
ships.flavor: A Valdore-type Romulan Warbird, The Valdore battled alongside the U.S.S. Enterprise against the Reman warbird the Scimitar at the battle in the Bassen Rift.

ships.name: Captain Proton Rocket Ship
ships.flavor: The heroic Captain Proton uses this heavily-armed rocket ship to defend Earth against dastardly villains!

ships.name: U.S.S. Enterprise NCC-1701-A
ships.flavor: The second Federation ship to bear the name "Enterprise," this Constitution-class vessel is equipped with improved tactical modifications and boasts a powerful warp core drive.

ships.name: Xindi-Insectoid Patrol Ship
ships.flavor: This small starship used by the Xindi-Insectoids is equipped with multiple directed energy-weapon emitters. As a Patrol ship, it is best known for its speed and maneuverability.

ships.name: The Scimitar
ships.flavor: A heavily-armed warship constructed by Shinzon for the sole purpose of overthrowing the Romulan Empire.

ships.name: U.S.S. Enterprise NCC-1701-E
ships.flavor: A Sovereign-class starship, which, after defeating a Borg Cube, went back in time to prevent the Borg from interfering with humanity's first contact with the Vulcans.

ships.name: Cardassian Keldon Class
ships.flavor: A Cardassian warship used during the 24th century, some of which were secretly enhanced with cloaking under the Obsidian Order and the Romulan Tal Shiar.

ships.name: Assimilated Voyager
ships.flavor: After an attack from a Species 8472 vessel, the Borg Cube defends the Voyager. Janeway agrees to a temporary alliance with the Borg, beginning with the Voyager's assimilation.

ships.name: Federation Fighter
ships.flavor: The cutting edge Federation Fighter first saw major action in the battle against Control at Xahea.

ships.name: The Artifact
ships.flavor: This Borg vessel is severed from the Collective and hosted both research and rehabilitation for xBs. Now active, its queencell, Borg population, and repair systems are engaged.

ships.name: La Sirena
ships.flavor: A Kaplan F17 Speed Freighter for hire, captained by Rios. Supplemented with a variety of Holoprograms to assist across a variety of dangerous emergency situations.

ships.name: Tholian Ship
ships.flavor: Equipped with an energy-dampener and the ability to create the infamous Tholian web, a near impenetrable tractor field.

ships.name: Krenim Weapon Ship
ships.flavor: Developed by Annorax to remove threats to the Krenim Empire via manipulation of the space-time continuum.

ships.name: Generational NX-01 Enterprise
ships.flavor: Finding themselves stranded in the 21st century, the Enterprise crew embarked on a multi-generational journey to prevent their past from yet again becoming the Enterprise's future.

ships.name: Borg Queens Vessel
ships.flavor: The Borg utilize this vessel to transport the Borg Queen within a shielded chamber that is still capable of immense destruction on the vanguard of assimilation efforts.

ships.name: U.S.S. T'Kumbra
ships.flavor: Commanded by the decorated Captain Solok, this all-Vulcan crewed Nebula-class was at the front lines of the Dominion War.

ships.name: Warship Voyager
ships.flavor: According to the Kyrian Heritage, this warship commanded by the brutal Captain Janeway terrorized the Kyrian people with biogenic weapons.

ships.name: I.S.S. Discovery
ships.flavor: Captained by the fearsome Sylvia "Killy" Tilly, the I.S.S. Discovery was destroyed by Klingon forces upon arrival in the prime universe.

ships.name: U.S.S. Prometheus
ships.flavor: This prototypal Federation ship's experimental assault modes and warp factor 9.99 capability made it a priority target for Romulan hijackers.

ships.name: Harrad-Sar's Barge
ships.flavor: While pretending to command a mining vessel, Harrad-Sar launched an operation to seize control of the Enterprise and deliver it into Orion hands.

events.name: A Pied Piper
events.description: Red Alert! Your ship has been attacked by Jodmos--the alias of Captain Benjamin Sisko when disguised as a Klingon. Is this attack related to Neelix's disappearance and possible disguise as another species?
events.rules:
-- In a Skirmish Event, you will engage in space battles against thematically appropriate foes until the Event's conclusion.
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- Unique Ship Battle Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of Adira, Burnham, Sisko, Waddle, Costumed crew, or crew with matching Battle Traits, will provide a bonus.
-- Using the U.S.S. Excelsior, Hirogen Warship, and D'Kora Marauder will provide a bonus to hull.
-- Every Ship Battle you win earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
events.bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Adira, Burnham, Sisko, Waddle, or Costumed

events.name: In Plain Sight
events.description: Neelix remains missing, and he may be hidden in plain sight. Research all the ways Neelix could be disguised or altered from his normal Talaxian appearance, and how to get around them to find him.
events.rules:
-- Unique Supply Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of Saru, Culber, Torres, Waddle, or crew with the Costumed trait will provide a bonus to Supply Missions.
-- Every Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are only available during Phase 1. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
events.bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Saru, Culber, Torres, Waddle, or Costumed
events.rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Supply Missions!

featured_crew.name: Adira
featured_crew.flavor: Sneaking medicine down to the landing party of Theta Zeta, Adira appears as a Xahean.

featured_crew.name: Culber
featured_crew.flavor: A malfunctioning holoprogram aboard the wreckage of the KSF Khi'eth made Culber appear Bajoran.
